{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control (QC) Inspector",
  "description": "Prime Atlantic Limited is a wholly Nigerian&ndash;owned company established in 2003 with the vision to be the preferred services and solutions company in Sub&ndash;Saharan Africa. As a full oil servicing company, we pride ourselves on offering the most comprehensive bouquet of solutions while subjecting our processes to the most stringent global standards, providing services and solutions to the Oil &amp; Gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Quality Control (QC) Inspector

Job Location:&nbsp;Offshore, Port Harcourt -&nbsp;Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Administration of all Quality Control and inspection activities at Site (EGINA FPSO) for Notifications, Projects &amp; Site Modification Requests.


Job Details


	Interface with the ECP Site management Team and the ECP Onshore Team for the Quality control / Inspection
	activities for welding, blasting and painting.
	Ensure only the correct consumables (for welding, blasting and painting) as stipulated by the approved WPS
	/ procedures are in use on site by the welders, blasters and painters.
	Ensure only Qualified artisans (welding, blasters and painters) are deployed for all activities
	Ensure continuous update of the welder&rsquo;s qualifications.
	Verifying conformity of the work to specified Quality Requirements and ensuring that the inspections and
	controls are carried out and documented in accordance with the Quality Procedure.
	Controls coating and welding parameters and consumables during installation/construction activities,
	Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan by the Construction team / Contractor.
	Checks the availability and suitability of the filler material, preheating, welding, heat treatment, and the bevels.
	The extent of the repairs made by the various welders, and taking any corrective actions
	Carry out visual inspections, verify dimensional correctness and monitor defect removal by Magnetic
	Permeability Inspection (MPI).
	Inspect all materials on arrival at the site for conformity.
	Prepare weekly and monthly project progress reports.
	Ensure proper storage of all consumables (welding and Painting) and manage material traceability
	Collate all (welding and coating) technical queries and report to the Onshore QAQC Engineer for Response
	Monitor the site Equipment calibration register to ensure only valid equipment is in use
	Take part in project meetings, where required, and prepare presentations to give the status of Inspection works, etc.
	Ensure proper close-out report of welding and coating works in the form of a weld history sheet and coating
	report to reflect the &lsquo;As Built&rsquo;.
	Prepare and issue weekly and monthly reports covering all quality inspection works on site.


Requirements


	Professional experience of 5 years of minimum in the Petroleum industry.
	Certifications &ndash; AWS CWI or CSWIP 3.1 (Level 2), Welding Inspector; NACE II or BGAS CSWIP, Painting Inspector Grade II
	Conversant with the International Standards, Codes and Total General Specifications
	Verifiable experience in the use of MS Office packages.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Prime Atlantic Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187955"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Quality Control (QC) Inspector Job at Prime Atlantic Limited




        
    

        
        Prime Atlantic Limited is a wholly Nigerian–owned company established in 2003 with the vision to be the preferred services and solutions company in Sub–Saharan Africa. As a full oil servicing company, we pride ourselves on offering the most comprehensive bouquet of solutions while subjecting our processes to the most stringent global standards, providing services and solutions to the Oil & Gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control (QC) Inspector

Job Location: Offshore, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Administration of all Quality Control and inspection activities at Site (EGINA FPSO) for Notifications, Projects & Site Modification Requests.


Job Details


	Interface with the ECP Site management Team and the ECP Onshore Team for the Quality control / Inspection
	activities for welding, blasting and painting.
	Ensure only the correct consumables (for welding, blasting and painting) as stipulated by the approved WPS
	/ procedures are in use on site by the welders, blasters and painters.
	Ensure only Qualified artisans (welding, blasters and painters) are deployed for all activities
	Ensure continuous update of the welder’s qualifications.
	Verifying conformity of the work to specified Quality Requirements and ensuring that the inspections and
	controls are carried out and documented in accordance with the Quality Procedure.
	Controls coating and welding parameters and consumables during installation/construction activities,
	Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan by the Construction team / Contractor.
	Checks the availability and suitability of the filler material, preheating, welding, heat treatment, and the bevels.
	The extent of the repairs made by the various welders, and taking any corrective actions
	Carry out visual inspections, verify dimensional correctness and monitor defect removal by Magnetic
	Permeability Inspection (MPI).
	Inspect all materials on arrival at the site for conformity.
	Prepare weekly and monthly project progress reports.
	Ensure proper storage of all consumables (welding and Painting) and manage material traceability
	Collate all (welding and coating) technical queries and report to the Onshore QAQC Engineer for Response
	Monitor the site Equipment calibration register to ensure only valid equipment is in use
	Take part in project meetings, where required, and prepare presentations to give the status of Inspection works, etc.
	Ensure proper close-out report of welding and coating works in the form of a weld history sheet and coating
	report to reflect the ‘As Built’.
	Prepare and issue weekly and monthly reports covering all quality inspection works on site.


Requirements


	Professional experience of 5 years of minimum in the Petroleum industry.
	Certifications – AWS CWI or CSWIP 3.1 (Level 2), Welding Inspector; NACE II or BGAS CSWIP, Painting Inspector Grade II
	Conversant with the International Standards, Codes and Total General Specifications
	Verifiable experience in the use of MS Office packages.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Call Center Agent",
  "description": "CodeLabProjects Group(CLP) is an American conglomerate of companies, Located in the Maryland,U.S.A and currently expanding operations to Liberia, Nigeria, Ghana, Ethiopia,the Caribbean other part of Africa and Asia, currently headquartered in the U.S, As of 2018.

At CodelabProjects we have concentrated on these assets to deliver solutions that improve customer performance over the years. Today, We support small and large businesses around the world. We go the extra mile by gaining deep understanding of our client&#39;s business environment,trends and applying most relevant solutions that would definitely ensure a return-on-investment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Center Agent

Job Location:&nbsp;Delta
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

About the Role


	We&rsquo;re on the hunt for a charismatic communicator who knows how to win people over with just their voice (and maybe a little charm).
	As our Call Centre Agent / Virtual Sales Assistant, you&rsquo;ll be the frontline closer&mdash;handling inbound/outbound calls, following up on leads, and turning interest into action.
	This isn&rsquo;t your average customer support gig&mdash;we need someone who can talk the talk and close the deal.


Responsibilities
What You&#39;ll Be Doing:


	Make and receive calls with confidence, clarity, and professionalism
	Engage prospects, build rapport quickly, and pitch services/products effectively
	Follow up on warm leads and turn them into paying customers
	Keep records of interactions, track conversions, and update CRM tools
	Handle inquiries via phone, email, or chat in a friendly, persuasive tone
	Assist in marketing tasks like email outreach, follow-ups, and appointment scheduling.


Requirements
What We&#39;re Looking For:


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree with 2 years work experience.
	Fluent, articulate English speaker with a warm, confident voice
	Strong background in sales, marketing, or telemarketing
	Proven ability to close deals&mdash;you know how to turn a &ldquo;maybe&rdquo; into a &ldquo;yes!&rdquo;
	Comfortable working with sales scripts, objection handling, and CRM tools
	Organized, reliable, and self-motivated
	Ability to adapt your tone and pitch depending on the client
	This is an Onsite role in Delta.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@codelabprojects.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Screening Questions


	Where do you stay?
	How many years of experience do you have editing videos?
	What&#39;s your highest qualification?
	Can you start immediately?
	Have you completed your NYSC?


Note


	This is an onsite role and not a remote role.
	Only candidates living within Ughelli, Warri, and its environs will be considered.

Call Center Agent Job at CodeLabProjects Group




        
    

        
        CodeLabProjects Group(CLP) is an American conglomerate of companies, Located in the Maryland,U.S.A and currently expanding operations to Liberia, Nigeria, Ghana, Ethiopia,the Caribbean other part of Africa and Asia, currently headquartered in the U.S, As of 2018.

At CodelabProjects we have concentrated on these assets to deliver solutions that improve customer performance over the years. Today, We support small and large businesses around the world. We go the extra mile by gaining deep understanding of our client's business environment,trends and applying most relevant solutions that would definitely ensure a return-on-investment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Center Agent
     

            
    



Job Location: Delta
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

About the Role


	We’re on the hunt for a charismatic communicator who knows how to win people over with just their voice (and maybe a little charm).
	As our Call Centre Agent / Virtual Sales Assistant, you’ll be the frontline closer—handling inbound/outbound calls, following up on leads, and turning interest into action.
	This isn’t your average customer support gig—we need someone who can talk the talk and close the deal.


Responsibilities
What You'll Be Doing:


	Make and receive calls with confidence, clarity, and professionalism
	Engage prospects, build rapport quickly, and pitch services/products effectively
	Follow up on warm leads and turn them into paying customers
	Keep records of interactions, track conversions, and update CRM tools
	Handle inquiries via phone, email, or chat in a friendly, persuasive tone
	Assist in marketing tasks like email outreach, follow-ups, and appointment scheduling.


Requirements
What We're Looking For:


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree with 2 years work experience.
	Fluent, articulate English speaker with a warm, confident voice
	Strong background in sales, marketing, or telemarketing
	Proven ability to close deals—you know how to turn a “maybe” into a “yes!”
	Comfortable working with sales scripts, objection handling, and CRM tools
	Organized, reliable, and self-motivated
	Ability to adapt your tone and pitch depending on the client
	This is an Onsite role in Delta.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Screening Questions


	Where do you stay?
	How many years of experience do you have editing videos?
	What's your highest qualification?
	Can you start immediately?
	Have you completed your NYSC?


Note


	This is an onsite role and not a remote role.
	Only candidates living within Ughelli, Warri, and its environs will be considered.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Bukka Hut Restaurant is a fast-growing organization with almost 20 outlets in Lagos and care greatly about our staff. Beyond hospitality, Bukka Hut thrives as a people-centric brand with a laser focus on championing people empowerment initiatives. We like to view our business sectors as channels used to transform the lives of our stakeholders. This stems from our internal workforce to the community we operate in.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;MMA2 - Airport Road, Ikeja / Ogudu - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate inventory records, including detailed information on stock levels, orders, and deliveries.
	Conduct regular inventory audits and physical counts to reconcile inventory data.
	Ensure inventory accuracy through effective cycle counting and adjustment processes.
	Monitor stock levels and ensure that inventory is replenished in a timely manner.
	Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of inventory.
	Generate and analyze inventory-related reports to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for improvement.
	Oversee the store&#39;s daily operations, ensuring efficient and organized inventory storage.
	Implement and enforce store safety protocols and procedures.
	Manage and resolve any discrepancies between physical inventory and inventory records.
	Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inventory transactions.
	Identify opportunities to improve inventory management processes and systems.
	Implement best practices for inventory control and management.
	Work with other departments to streamline inventory-related processes.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / OND / Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 1 - 2 years of work experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N89,000 monthly.

Method of Application
interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@bukkahut.com&nbsp;using &quot;Asst.Inventory Officer&quot;as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "BukkaHut Restaurant"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187951"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Assistant Inventory Officer Job at Bukka Hut Restaurant




        
    

        
        Bukka Hut Restaurant is a fast-growing organization with almost 20 outlets in Lagos and care greatly about our staff. Beyond hospitality, Bukka Hut thrives as a people-centric brand with a laser focus on championing people empowerment initiatives. We like to view our business sectors as channels used to transform the lives of our stakeholders. This stems from our internal workforce to the community we operate in.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Inventory Officer

Job Location: MMA2 - Airport Road, Ikeja / Ogudu - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate inventory records, including detailed information on stock levels, orders, and deliveries.
	Conduct regular inventory audits and physical counts to reconcile inventory data.
	Ensure inventory accuracy through effective cycle counting and adjustment processes.
	Monitor stock levels and ensure that inventory is replenished in a timely manner.
	Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of inventory.
	Generate and analyze inventory-related reports to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for improvement.
	Oversee the store's daily operations, ensuring efficient and organized inventory storage.
	Implement and enforce store safety protocols and procedures.
	Manage and resolve any discrepancies between physical inventory and inventory records.
	Prepare and submit regular inventory reports to management.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inventory transactions.
	Identify opportunities to improve inventory management processes and systems.
	Implement best practices for inventory control and management.
	Work with other departments to streamline inventory-related processes.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / OND / Bachelor's Degree with 1 - 2 years of work experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N89,000 monthly.

Method of Application
interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@bukkahut.com using "Asst.Inventory Officer"as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
